page.title: 12Oliver Cromwell, St Ives
page.content:
Oliver Cromwell is perhaps the most famous person to have lived locally. He was born in Huntingdon in 1599, married in 1620 and died in 1658 at the age of 59.
A bronze statue of him stands prominently on Market Hill in St Ives. This statue is at present being refurbished at a cost of Â£800.
Cromwell's life and that of his family is very well documented. Papers, books and documents can be seen at the Norris Museum in St Ives. Further study can be undertaken at the Cromwell Museum in Huntingdon, where a death mask can be seen. This museum is housed in the building where the young Oliver went to school.
